examples: We won’t be promoting Larry.
She teaches yoga to promote health and well-being.
The organization is committed to promoting equality and fairness for every person.
Anna was promoted to manager last year, and she's been in the fast lane ever since.
Earth Day is observed on April 22nd to promote environmental awareness.
words.defineEn: to move to a higher position or rank
words.defineVi: để di chuyển đến một vị trí cao hơn hoặc xếp hạng

examples: Some of the people don't deserve a single red cent.
I had broken the law and deserved to be punished.
I had broken the law and deserved to be punished.
The landlord finally made some repairs in the apartment, but it was only after several complaints and threats of legal action, and a forced kindness deserves no thanks.
The charity organization's mission statement emphasized the belief that poverty is no sin and that everyone deserves dignity and respect.
words.defineEn: to do a particular thing or have the qualities needed for being punished or rewarded
words.defineVi: để làm một điều cụ thể hoặc có những phẩm chất cần thiết để bị trừng phạt hoặc khen thưởng

examples: Alex will play ball with the opposing team, despite their differences, in order to promote sportsmanship and fair play.
But the king's advisors strongly opposed these initiatives.
You opposed busing.
They strongly opposed the Oslo agreement.
Opposed him.
words.defineEn: to strongly disagree with a policy, plan, idea, etc. and try to put an end to it
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn không đồng ý với một chính sách, kế hoạch, ý tưởng, v.v. và cố gắng chấm dứt nó

examples: A better teacher would have licked him into shape.
Wow, Jim has really gotten in shape lately.
We learn about shapes and measurements in our math class.
The ugli fruit's bright orange color and unique shape make it a fun and eye-catching addition to fruit platters.
Hey, don't get all bent out of shape!
words.defineEn: to give something a particular form
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho một cái gì đó một hình thức cụ thể

examples: Let your body relax.
The hot water in the shower helped me relax after a long day.
We spent our vacation relaxing on the sandy beaches by the sea.
You sit down and relax.
As the sun beat down, they relaxed on the beach, sipping on cold beverages with slices of lime rind floating on top.
words.defineEn: to feel less worried or stressed
words.defineVi: để cảm thấy bớt lo lắng hoặc căng thẳng

examples: As the sun rose over the horizon, Mark emerged from his deep slumber and joined the rest of his family in the living room, finally in the land of the living.
When he finally emerged, his disheveled appearance made him look a sight to behold.
She examined the potato closely, noticing the small eye where a new sprout would eventually emerge.
The kids emerged from the woods looking none the worse for wear.
After surviving a dangerous accident, Lily emerged alive and well, grateful for a second chance at life.
words.defineEn: to become visible after coming out of somewhere
words.defineVi: trở nên hữu hình sau khi ra khỏi một nơi nào đó

examples: The river flows through the valley, creating a beautiful landscape.
You have to accept the ebb and flow of love in a relationship.
I have a better flow of spirits this morning, and, in fact, feel as fine as frog's hair.
She imagined a magical land where the trees were made of cotton candy and the rivers flowed with white sugar.
But he soon realized that every flow has its ebb, and sales started slowing down again.
words.defineEn: to move continuously, steadily, and easily in one direction, especially in a current or stream
words.defineVi: di chuyển liên tục, đều đặn và dễ dàng theo một hướng, đặc biệt là theo dòng chảy hoặc dòng chảy

examples: His argument rests on shaky ground.
He gently rested his chin on her shoulder.
The rest of his money went into medical expenses.
May she rest in peace.
I rested my head on a soft pillow to sleep.
words.defineEn: to stop working, moving, or doing an activity for a period of time and sit or lie down to relax
words.defineVi: ngừng làm việc, di chuyển hoặc thực hiện một hoạt động trong một khoảng thời gian và ngồi hoặc nằm xuống để thư giãn

examples: She almost shouted bloody murder on top of her lungs.
His shout scared me witless.
I wanted to shout at the man for jumping the line, but I was too embarrassed about making a scene.
I'd shouted blue murder every time someone tried to kiss me.
Anger and shouting simply aren’t a part of his idiom.
words.defineEn: to speak in a loud voice, especially when we are angry or when we cannot hear what the other person is saying
words.defineVi: nói to, đặc biệt là khi chúng ta tức giận hoặc khi chúng ta không thể nghe thấy những gì người khác đang nói

examples: He went to the wall to defend his beliefs.
Guys, do you even know the sexist history of the company you're so ardently defending?
Jack could be mild-mannered and amicable most of the time, but when his children were criticized, he fiercely defended them.
The mother who always defended her child's behavior, even when it was clearly inappropriate, demonstrated that love is blind.
- Defend the virtual farm?
words.defineEn: to not let any harm come to someone or something
words.defineVi: để không để bất kỳ thiệt hại đến với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: To some extent such insistent emphasis hammers the argument home, rather than inviting the reader to engage with it.
The athlete decided to distance himself from teammates who engaged in doping, recognizing that bad company corrupts good morals.
Jack is actually a very funny, engaging guy when he comes out of his shell.
Wealthy bachelor Jimmy Norton, engaged to a gold digger, lies his way out of a speeding ticket by claiming to be on his way to visit his daughter at the Children's Hospital.
When Sarah and Jack got engaged, everyone was overjoyed, because all the world loves a lover.
words.defineEn: to take part in an activity
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một hoạt động

examples: she yelled and tossed the keys to Veronica.
You can yell your head off at him, but he still won't listen.
You scared the daylights out of me, yelling like that.
The boss came in, yelling and generally throwing his weight around.
He completely lost his cool and started yelling.
words.defineEn: to shout very loudly
words.defineVi: hét rất to

examples: The closing of the airport knocked our holiday plans on the head.
The fall knocked the wind out of me.
But, it'll knock the breath out of them for a while.
The athlete's record-breaking performance in the championship game knocked his opponents out of the park, securing his place in history and earning him widespread admiration and respect.
It's nearly done - another couple of hours should knock it on the head.
words.defineEn: to hit a door, surface, etc. in a way to attract attention, especially expecting it to be opened
words.defineVi: đập vào cửa, bề mặt, v.v. theo cách để thu hút sự chú ý, đặc biệt là mong nó được mở ra

examples: They couldn't predict the disastrous war looming a few years down the road.
The weather forecast predicted a cloudy morning followed by clearing in the afternoon.
If you pay close attention to people's behavior and actions, you can often predict their intentions, as a straw will show which way the wind blows.
It's difficult to predict what will happen, but we need to trust that the process will take its course.
The outcome, as anybody could have predicted, has been much less bang for the bucks.
words.defineEn: to say that something is going to happen before it actually takes place
words.defineVi: để nói rằng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra trước khi nó thực sự diễn ra

examples: Mind your own business!
You mind the cattle, Herb.
Mind if I take a rain check on that drink?
Travel broadens the mind.
My mind went totally blank.
words.defineEn: (often used in negative or question form) to be upset, annoyed or worried by something or someone
words.defineVi: (thường dùng ở thể phủ định hoặc nghi vấn) bực bội, khó chịu hoặc lo lắng vì điều gì hoặc ai đó

examples: As the saying goes, physician, heal thyself.
That cut is taking a long time to heal.
After going through a painful breakup, I thought I would never be able to love again, but time heals all wounds, and I eventually moved on.
After the accident, I was in a lot of pain, but the doctor reassured me that time works wonders and that I would heal.
Maybe heal another energy.
words.defineEn: to become healthy again
words.defineVi: trở nên khỏe mạnh trở lại

examples: The winner extended an olive branch to his opponent by calling him a great player.
Plans to extend the hotel have now been passed.
Will future technologies, like cell-repairing nanobots, or gene therapy, artificially extend our years?
One species, the spotted wobbegong, can extend its mouth further than the length of its own head.
The fundamental theorem of algebra, it extends our number system.
words.defineEn: to enlarge or lengthen something
words.defineVi: để phóng to hoặc kéo dài một cái gì đó

examples: I lost track of the time.
They kept track of their mileage.
The road follows the track of the railway line.
The track led us through a wood.
Seeing flames behind a dune during one of her walks, the female narrator stops in her tracks.
words.defineEn: to follow someone or something by examining the marks they leave behind in order to catch them or know what they are doing
words.defineVi: theo dõi ai đó hoặc cái gì đó bằng cách kiểm tra các dấu vết họ để lại để bắt họ hoặc biết họ đang làm gì

examples: The presence of green algae in water bodies can indicate the health and balance of the ecosystem.
The company's financial report showed a significant increase in yield, indicating successful productivity and growth.
The professor's office hours are posted on the door, indicating when he is available for student consultations.
She felt a rumble in her stomach, indicating that she was hungry.
The building passed the safety inspection and received a clean bill of health, indicating that it was safe for occupancy
words.defineEn: to represent something; to suggest that something is likely
words.defineVi: để đại diện cho một cái gì đó; để gợi ý rằng một cái gì đó có khả năng

examples: Mark my words.
We mark important passages in a book with a pencil underline.
The classroom ruler is marked in both inches and centimeters for easy measurement.
We should mark the date on the calendar for our family gathering.
Years of war have left their mark on these pretty islands.
words.defineEn: to leave a sign, line, etc. on something
words.defineVi: để lại một dấu hiệu, dòng, vv trên một cái gì đó

examples: Wrap the rice and fresh ingredients in gim to create a delectable sushi roll.
The gardener carefully wrapped the stem of the young tree with burlap to protect it from frost during winter.
The name of the movie is being kept under wraps.
I brought paneer wraps for lunch today.
Sushi rolls are often wrapped in sheets of edible algae, known as nori.
words.defineEn: to cover an object in paper or other soft fabric
words.defineVi: để che một đối tượng trong giấy hoặc vải mềm khác

examples: I'm sorry to split hairs, but your portion of the bill is $25.97, not $25.79.
This may seem like splitting hairs but the distinction could be important
I actually think it was your responsibility, not Dave's, but let's not split hairs about it.
With a crack, the shell of the chestnut split open, revealing the smooth and glossy nut inside.
Any government that seeks to split its opponents is dividing and ruling.
words.defineEn: to be divided into smaller groups or parts
words.defineVi: được chia thành các nhóm hoặc bộ phận nhỏ hơn

examples: Recycling waste saves energy.
This guy is a waste of skin!
He wasted a golden opportunity when he missed from the penalty spot.
This is your fault, you waste of skin!
The agent counsels them obliquely against waste, repeats the letter of the law, and smiles.
words.defineEn: to use something without care or more than needed
words.defineVi: để sử dụng một cái gì đó mà không quan tâm hoặc nhiều hơn mức cần thiết

examples: She enjoys going to class because she gets to learn new things and interact with classmates.
As Jessica watched her son's new girlfriend interact with their family, she couldn't help but feel a bit uncomfortable, considering that the girl appeared to be old enough to be his mother.
I watched as the monkey interacted with other members of its troop.
The way the CEO interacted with the employees caused many people to take notice of her leadership style.
The friends have become inseparable, living in each other's pocket and rarely interacting with others.
words.defineEn: to communicate with others, particularly while spending time with them
words.defineVi: để giao tiếp với người khác, đặc biệt là trong khi dành thời gian với họ

examples: The state has taken control of the company.
The victim of the robbery stated that the assailant had slipped him a Mickey Finn at the bar.
More conservative candidates are losing ground in key battleground states.
The teacher drummed the names of the state capitals into our heads.
Religious instruction is banned in all state schools in the country.
words.defineEn: to formally express something in speech or writing, particularly in a clear way
words.defineVi: để chính thức thể hiện một cái gì đó trong bài phát biểu hoặc bằng văn bản, đặc biệt là trong một cách rõ ràng
